snippet: Troubles in the euro zone and rising prices may send the British economy back into contraction in the fourth quarter, the governor of the Bank of England said.
abstract: Bank of England governor Mervyn King says British economy might shrink again in the fourth quarter as troubles in the euro zone and rising prices take their toll on fragile recovery; says inflation will remain above 2 percent.
lead_paragraph: Troubles in the euro zone and rising prices may send the British economy back into contraction in the fourth quarter, the governor of the Bank of England said.

headline.seo: Bank of England Offers Somber Assessment of British Economy
headline.main: Central Bank Projects More Slow Growth for Britain
headline.print_headline: Central Bank Projects More Slow Growth For Britain
